result.execSummary:
The defendant William J. Shecterle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DE must submit an apology to victim/victims in way and manner to be determined by probation agent.
Enroll and successfully complete the next Batterer's Group
Defendant may not have contact with Lola Baars, unless written consent is given by victim, and is allowed by probation agent.

records.addlTxt:
11:00 am - DA calls case and states appearances.  Defendant William J. Shecterle in court with attorney John H. Wallace.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to all counts.  Court questions DE regarding the plea and plea questionnaire and waiver.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC.  DA can certify victims rights compliance.  DA presents victim impact statement to DE and Court. DE to submit DNA sample at PRSO. Court imposes:

Sentence withheld - 2 years probation
Conditions of probation:
$243 court costs
$200 DNAAS
$100 domestic abuse surcharge
DE must submit an apology to victim/victims in way and manner to be determined by probation agent.
Enroll and successfully complete the next Batterer's Group
Defendant may not have contact with Lola Baars, unless consent is given by victim, and is allowed by probation agent.

Appeal rights given.
Request for Documents and Motion for Discovery
Motion for Discovery and Demand for Discovery
Motion hearing on June 17, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Motion hearing on May 27, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Defendant William J. Shecterle appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.   DE plans to retain an attorney.  Court gives DE another notice of right to atty. DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.    Notice of right to attorney given to DE. Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled. Bond to continue.
State's Demand for Discovery & Notice of Intent to Use DNA Evidence

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release. Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.   DE may not have contact with Lola Baars, unless there is written consent on file.

Plaintiff, District Attorney Mark T. Fuhr, in person. Defendant, in person, in custody. Case called, appearances and possible charges stated. Defendant's next court date is 10-27-15 at 10:00 am. Court gives defendant notice of right to attorney and victim/witness intimidation form. Court questions parties as to bond. DA states bond recommendation. Court grants DA 5 business days in which to file complaint.
